channel.title: math.AT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Swan-Tate cohomology of meromorphic circle actions
item.description: arXiv:2403.19714v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose a toy model for symmetry-breaking or bubbling, in terms of cobordism of manifolds with circle actions free on a possible boundary.
item.dc:creator: J Morava

item.title: Infinitesimal calculations in fundamental groups
item.description: arXiv:2403.20264v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that Hopf invariants, defined by evaluation in Harrison cohomology of the commutative cochains of a space, calculate the logarithm map from a fundamental group to its Malcev Lie algebra. They thus present the zeroth Harrison cohomology as a universal dual object to the Malcev Lie algebra. This structural theorem supports explicit calculations in algebraic topology, geometric topology and combinatorial group theory. In particular, we give the first algorithm to determine whether a word raised to some power is a k-fold nested product of commutators, in any group presented by generators and relations.
item.dc:creator: Nir Gadish, Aydin Ozbek, Dev Sinha, Ben Walter

item.title: Choice axioms and Postnikov completeness
item.description: arXiv:2403.19772v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We introduce homotopical variants of the axioms of countable and dependent choice for infinity-topoi and use them to give criteria for Postnikov completeness, revisiting a result of Mondal and Reinecke.
item.dc:creator: Mathieu Anel, Reid Barton

item.title: Twisted simplicial distributions
item.description: arXiv:2403.19808v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We introduce a theory of twisted simplicial distributions on simplicial principal bundles, which allow us to capture Bell's non-locality, and the more general notion of quantum contextuality. We leverage the classical theory of simplicial principal bundles, as well as structures on categories of such bundles, to provide powerful computational tools for analyzing twisted distributions in terms of both direct constructions in simplicial sets and techniques from homological algebra. We use these techniques to analyze our key examples: quantum distributions and operator-theoretic polytopes used in the classical simulation of quantum computation.
item.dc:creator: Cihan Okay, Walker H. Stern

item.title: On generic singularities of intersections of ellipsoids: the octahedron
item.description: arXiv:2403.20286v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The goal of this work is to study the smoothings of singular coaxial intersections of ellipsoids (where coaxial includes concentric) with generic singularities, with special attention to the 3-dimensional case.
item.dc:creator: Enrique Artal Bartolo, Santiago L\'opez de Medrano, Mar\'ia Teresa Lozano Im\`izcoz

item.title: Twisted Quasi-elliptic cohomology and twisted equivariant elliptic cohomology
item.description: arXiv:2006.00554v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper we construct a twisted version of quasi-elliptic cohomology. This theory can be constructed as a K-theory of a loop space. After establishing basic properties of the theory, including restriction, change-of-group and induction maps, we construct the Chern character map. And we compute the twisted quasi-elliptic cohomology theories of representation 4-spheres acted by the finite subgroups of SU(2), which, as conjectured by Sati and Schreiber, can produce good observables on M-brane charge in a Tate-elliptic enhancement of D-brane charge in twisted equivariant K-theory.
item.dc:creator: Zhen Huan
